text: The 2019 Nobel Prize for Physiology or Medicine has been awarded to three researchers who discovered how cells sense and adapt to oxygen levels. Their work is being used in new treatments for anemia, cancer and other diseases. The Swedish Academy says "The fundamental importance of oxygen has been understood for centuries but how cells adapt to changes in levels of oxygen has long been unknown." It is the 110th prize in the category awarded since 1901, awarding $1.4 million prize money to be shared among the three researchers. Image: Getty
